properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 6 at 12:05PM EST until February 6 at 8:55PM EST by NWS Peachtree City GA
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a Flood
Warning for the following rivers in Georgia...

Noonday Creek near Woodstock affecting Cherokee and Cobb Counties


.Recent heavy rainfall has caused significant runoff into streams and
rivers which will cause flooding in some areas.

The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a
* Flood Warning for
The Noonday Creek near Woodstock.
* From this afternoon until this evening.
* At 11AM Thursday the stage was 9.7 feet...and rising.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Flood stage is 10 feet.
* Forecast to rise above flood stage by this afternoon and continue
to rise to near 10.5 feet by this afternoon. The river will fall
below flood stage by this afternoon.
* At 10 feet...Flood Stage is reached. Minor flooding begins in the
woodlands and natural flood plain near the creek upstream and
downstream from the gage on Shallowford Road. Portions of Noonday
Creek Park and residential backyards on Bridge Drive will begin to
flood.
properties.instruction:
All persons with interests along the river should monitor the latest
forecasts...and be prepared to take necessary precautions to protect
life and property.

The latest stage data was furnished in cooperation with the United
States Geological Survey.
